title: Vendor flake8
body:
We currently don't vendor `flake8`.  This is an attempt to do that.  @adamjstewart 

After attempting to do it, I think we *should not* vendor `flake8`, because things get rather nasty:

1. `flake8` requires `setuptools` to run, so we would need to vendor `setuptools`
    * specifically, it requires `pkg_resources` (provide by `setuptools`) to figure out what formatters to use for its output.
2. Vendoring `setuptools` is a pain, and I am not sure I want to get quite so low-level in what we vendor in Spack.  This PR (which does not vendor `setuptools` and friends) already increases the number of lines in `lib/spack/external` a lot.
3. There is no good way to bypass the `setuptools` requirement, as `flake8` has no public API to just check some files programmatically.  We have to run the `flake8` command, or `python -m flake8` from within `spack flake8`.
4. When you try to call `flake8` *indirectly* from within `python` using `sys.executable`, it doesn't seem to know how to set things up for `pkg_resources`.  `flake8` dies looking for its formatter, like this:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.13/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 174, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.13/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code
    exec code in run_globals
  File "/Users/gamblin2/src/spack/lib/spack/external/flake8/__main__.py", line 4, in <module>
    cli.main()
  File "/Users/gamblin2/src/spack/lib/spack/external/flake8/main/cli.py", line 16, in main
    app.run(argv)
  File "/Users/gamblin2/src/spack/lib/spack/external/flake8/main/application.py", line 316, in run
    self._run(argv)
  File "/Users/gamblin2/src/spack/lib/spack/external/flake8/main/application.py", line 299, in _run
    self.initialize(argv)
  File "/Users/gamblin2/src/spack/lib/spack/external/flake8/main/application.py", line 292, in initialize
    self.make_formatter()
  File "/Users/gamblin2/src/spack/lib/spack/external/flake8/main/application.py", line 192, in make_formatter
    format_plugin, self.formatting_plugins['default']
  File "/Users/gamblin2/src/spack/lib/spack/external/flake8/plugins/manager.py", line 338, in __getitem__
    return self.plugins[name]
KeyError: 'default'
```

I'm opening this PR so people can see what happened.  If someone has a good idea about how we might vendor this more effectively, let me know, otherwise let's close it.

I think we should wait until `flake8` has a [stable API](http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/user/python-api.html) or until Spack can install its own build tools as discussed in #3181.
